thread.title: Grant Elliot reveals backstory to 'bat drop' celebration
thread.title_full: Grant Elliot reveals backstory to 'bat drop' celebration

title: Grant Elliot reveals backstory to 'bat drop' celebration
text:
Naturally, Elliott won plenty of admirers for his flamboyant showmanship. 
Let’s re-live the moment once again 19.2 SIX! Grant Elliot match-winning SIX for Lahore Qalandars! — PakistanSuperLeague (@thePSLt20) February 20, 2017 
But it was unclear what inspired the Kiwi all-rounder to do such an act. Speaking to Geo News, Elliot revealed why he mimicked the popular 'drop the mic' move. 
"I don't mind bit of rap music every now and then. Sometimes they sign off just by dropping the mic. It's sort of like the end of the session. It is defiant sort of message that it’s over," he explained. 
A mic drop is the gesture of intentionally dropping one's microphone at the end of a performance or speech to signal a moment of triumph. Figuratively, it is an expression of victory for a successful event, indicating a boastful attitude toward one's own performance. 
Elliot said T20 cricket is exciting, entertaining, and that people should express themselves while enjoying the cricket. 
"I guess that's what I was doing. Trying to make it entertaining and exciting for the crowd. And hopefully, we'll get more Qalandar fans because of it [bat drop],” he added. 
OR may be he just took inspiration from former US president! 
The coolest finisher of all time! Take a bow! More Stories From PSL
